DataElement.preferredDefinition: The assigned dictionary code for the information affixed to the sample container that contains all additional required information to properly and completely identify the specimen.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Biospecimen Events Domain Analyte Specimen Label Classification
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An events domain that documents biospecimen collection and storage information._The sample or material being subjected to analysis._A set of information affixed to the sample container that contains all required information to properly and completely identify the specimen._A method of generalization, the systematic arrangement of entities into classes or groups based on mutual similarity and certain differing characteristics.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An events domain that documents biospecimen collection and storage information.

Concepts.definition: An events domain that documents biospecimen collection and storage information.

Property.preferredDefinition: The sample or material being subjected to analysis.:A set of information affixed to the sample container that contains all required information to properly and completely identify the specimen.:A method of generalization, the systematic arrangement of entities into classes or groups based on mutual similarity and certain differing characteristics.

Concepts.definition: The sample or material being subjected to analysis.
A set of information affixed to the sample container that contains all required information to properly and completely identify the specimen.
A method of generalization, the systematic arrangement of entities into classes or groups based on mutual similarity and certain differing characteristics.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A set of information affixed to the sample container that contains all required information to properly and completely identify the specimen._A method of generalization, the systematic arrangement of entities into classes or groups based on mutual similarity and certain differing characteristics._A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Part Two Tissue Non Baseline On Study

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Part Two Tissue Non Baseline On Study
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: One of the portions into which something is regarded as divided and which together constitute a whole.: A natural number greater than 1 and less than 3 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of one and one.: An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function.: An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.: A starting point to which things may be compared.: Actively participating in a study.

Concepts.definition: One of the portions into which something is regarded as divided and which together constitute a whole.
A natural number greater than 1 and less than 3 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of one and one.
An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function.
An operation in which a term denies or inverts the meaning of another term or construction.
A starting point to which things may be compared.
Actively participating in a study.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A peripheral blood cell with a single nucleus. This category includes lymphocytes and monocytes.

Concepts.definition: A peripheral blood cell with a single nucleus. This category includes lymphocytes and monocytes.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Plasma is the fluid (noncellular) portion of the circulating blood, as distinguished from the serum that is the fluid portion of the blood obtained by removal of the fibrin clot and blood cells after coagulation.

Concepts.definition: Plasma is the fluid (noncellular) portion of the circulating blood, as distinguished from the serum that is the fluid portion of the blood obtained by removal of the fibrin clot and blood cells after coagulation.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A blood collection tube with a formaldehyde-free preservative which stabilizes nucleated blood cells, preventing the release of genomic DNA, and allowing isolation of high-quality cell-free DNA.

Concepts.definition: A blood collection tube with a formaldehyde-free preservative which stabilizes nucleated blood cells, preventing the release of genomic DNA, and allowing isolation of high-quality cell-free DNA.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A blood collection tube that uses proprietary reagents for whole blood collection and stabilization prior to genomic DNA isolation.

Concepts.definition: A blood collection tube that uses proprietary reagents for whole blood collection and stabilization prior to genomic DNA isolation.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A proprietary blood collection tube used in the proprietary Smart Tube blood collection system. that is designed to stabilize whole blood samples for single-cell proteomics. Smart Tube is optimized to work with 1 milliliter of whole blood, proprietary Proteomic Stabilizer and reagents, and a base station that automates the temperature-controlled incubation and stabilization of samples for downstream single-cell analysis.

Concepts.definition: A proprietary blood collection tube used in the proprietary Smart Tube blood collection system. that is designed to stabilize whole blood samples for single-cell proteomics. Smart Tube is optimized to work with 1 milliliter of whole blood, proprietary Proteomic Stabilizer and reagents, and a base station that automates the temperature-controlled incubation and stabilization of samples for downstream single-cell analysis.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A blood collection tube that contains sodium heparin as an anticoagulant. This tube is used for preparing heparinized plasma, whole blood, and bone marrow specimens. It is identified by a green closure.

Concepts.definition: A blood collection tube that contains sodium heparin as an anticoagulant. This tube is used for preparing heparinized plasma, whole blood, and bone marrow specimens. It is identified by a green closure.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: BD Vacutainer ACD Solution B Tube

ValueMeaning.preferredName: BD Vacutainer ACD Solution B Tube
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A blood collection tube designed for the collection of whole blood or plasma. ACD Solution B contains trisodium citrate (13.2g/L), citric acid (4.8g/L) and dextrose (14.7g/L) and is identified by a yellow closure.

Concepts.longName: BD Vacutainer ACD Solution B Tube
Concepts.definition: A blood collection tube designed for the collection of whole blood or plasma. ACD Solution B contains trisodium citrate (13.2g/L), citric acid (4.8g/L) and dextrose (14.7g/L) and is identified by a yellow closure.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A proprietary blood collection tube for stabilization and isolation of total RNA from whole blood for gene expression analysis. When blood is drawn into the tube and mixed with the proprietary stabilizing reagent, lysis occurs almost immediately. The stabilizing reagent inactivates cellular RNases and selectively precipitates RNA, with genomic DNA and proteins remaining in solution.

Concepts.definition: A proprietary blood collection tube for stabilization and isolation of total RNA from whole blood for gene expression analysis. When blood is drawn into the tube and mixed with the proprietary stabilizing reagent, lysis occurs almost immediately. The stabilizing reagent inactivates cellular RNases and selectively precipitates RNA, with genomic DNA and proteins remaining in solution.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: One of the portions into which something is regarded as divided and which together constitute a whole.: A natural number greater than 1 and less than 3 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of one and one.: An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function.: A starting point to which things may be compared.: Any relevant actions that were performed or occurred prior to a specific treatment.

Concepts.definition: One of the portions into which something is regarded as divided and which together constitute a whole.
A natural number greater than 1 and less than 3 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of one and one.
An anatomical structure consisting of similarly specialized cells and intercellular matrix, aggregated according to genetically determined spatial relationships, performing a specific function.
A starting point to which things may be compared.
Any relevant actions that were performed or occurred prior to a specific treatment.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A set of information affixed to the sample container that contains all required information to properly and completely identify the specimen.:A method of generalization, the systematic arrangement of entities into classes or groups based on mutual similarity and certain differing characteristics.:A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

Concepts.definition: A set of information affixed to the sample container that contains all required information to properly and completely identify the specimen.
A method of generalization, the systematic arrangement of entities into classes or groups based on mutual similarity and certain differing characteristics.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.
